body: Sal Spera paced his roof, squinting at a steely October sky. He waited, fidgeted, phoned other roofs and dreamed of one of his 11 pigeons hurtling out of the heavens and winning everything. Suddenly a bird appeared. It circled, once, twice, three times, then flew away. "I'll die! I'll die!" Mr. Spera wailed. But he begged first. "Come home, baby!
title: An Old Sport, Still Aloft
